data.title: This place has tanked
data.text: I have given Cotton Row 3 chances to redeem themselves over a 6 month period and the result is the same. The first time I ever ordered the Braised Beef Short Ribs I was hooked and I absolutely loved them. They are awful now, The past 3,times I have ordered them they taste like a cheap chuck roast from Walmart. Actually, they have the same stringy texture as a cheap chuck roast. The service is horrendous at Cotton Row, even when the place is empty. You have to stay on top of your servers or you will be forgotten and have to wait 55 minutes for ice cold bread pudding. They are proud of food so hold on to your wallet because it will get punched when you dine there.  Skip this place, there are better options for food, service and value.

data.title: POSH SOUTHERN COUSINE
data.text:
Hi I'm Italian,
me and my boyfriend had a wonderfull dinner here....we eated typicall food combined with innovation and quality. Good service.....we remind that evening with pleasure....
I appreciated fried green tomato and coconut curry blu mussels.

data.title: Not Quite Fine Dining
data.text: Poor may be a harsh rating, but it is based on the "Fine Dining" category into which it is placed on TripAdvisor. The food and service were as expected, but the physical set up and atmosphere precludes this place from ever being fine dining. The restaurant is long and narrow, with a bar and wall-mounted chairs/tables on one side, the main aisle, and a row of tables on the other. The main aisle is crowded with servers, food runners, customers using the restroom, etc. There is constant traffic in this relatively narrow spot. Be prepared to have your chair kicked, bumped, etc. We won't be back.

data.title: Dinner with out-of-town relatives
data.text: After years of always eating at Cotton Row for special events, we will look elsewhere in Huntsville.  The last couple of visits have both been disappointing.  On our most recent trip two of our group ate less than half of a dish.  It was bad.  I did tell the waiter as I think customers should inform the staff of problems.  A replacement was offered but we declined.  It seems a decline has begun for a great restaurant that once was a huge treat for us.

data.title: Pretty good.
data.text:
Reservations via Open Table. On arrival we were escorted to the rear, down a flight of stairs, and into wine cellar and seated there alone. I wondered what we did wrong! But the wine cellar proved to be an  ideal location. We were not distracted by other patrons' conversations and were free to get a little silly from our drinks. My wife had a glass of Cava and I had a Balvenie Doublewood neat. Prices for these were reasonable. The liquor selection was first rate...they even had Pappy Van Winkle (which I turned down as I am saving for retirement).  

I started with the foie gras. It was served on a waffle with thinly sliced peaches and candied nuts in a balsamic glaze. I enjoyed it with a glass of RIesling. The sweetness of the wine was not overpowering and paired nicely with the foie gras. The candied nuts and waffle were also nice, but pushed the sweetness a little far. Still, I enjoyed my starter. My wife started with the butter lettuce salad with strawberries, pink grape fruit, and peaches. She found the salad dressing  a bit acidic for her, but overall she loved the salad. Rolls were brought, tasty and quite buttery/oily, but delicious.  

Our entrees (me): Divers scallops in a cream sauce on a bed of field peas, small pieces of fried okra, and Vidalia onions. I think the menu mentioned rocket, but I didn't perceive any of that in there. My wife got a filet with "peanut" (fingerling) potatoes italian pole beans, (quite chewy) porcini mushrooms, and (quite hard) carrots. She loved the steak, but not the veggies. We ordered a nice a fairly priced bottle of Jordan RR Chardonnay which paired nicely with my dinner. My wife likes white wines with anything, so she was happy. Dessert (her) was passable ice cream. I had the hazelnut mousse cake, which I did not love. 

Service was great. No complaints there. 

The bill came to nearly $300, so not a cheap date. Entrees and starters were great, desserts a bit disappointing.

data.title: Average food in a nice atmosphere
data.text: Went there for lunch on Friday.  12 noon.  Got a reservation, but the place was basically empty.  Really nice decor - stylish.  Waitress was a little too close by at all times - I think she listened to every word we said, and when she wasn't asking how everything was going the manager was right there in her place.  Annoying.  Food was average at best.  Prices were OK, but $10 for a 6oz draft beer was a bit silly.

data.title: Birthday Lunch
data.text: My boyfriend and I frequent this restaurant a lot, and it's always a great.  It was my first time having their lunch as we usually go for dinner.  I really enjoyed it. It wasn't heavy and was just enough food.  Not too much!  Service was great as always and food came in a timely manner!  We love this place.

data.title: Great Food!  Great Service!
data.text: This was our first visit and I was very impressed. First of all, the ambiance is nice. Even though it's on the square, inside is quiet and decorated nicely. It was evidently a former bank and even has the old safe door as part of the decor. The service is excellent. The food was delicious. It's high-end so it's more expensive but the amount served on the appetizers is generous. Excellent bar and desserts too!  We will be back.

data.title: Over-rated
data.text:
Lots of servers, slow service. (25 minutes to get a cocktail). Good entrees, but just as good a dozen other places in town. Salmon was supposed to come with eggplant. Didn't.  No refills on water without asking. No forks after appetizers. Four people deliver entrees to a table without forks. 
Nice atmosphere. I like D&L Bistro better. 
Oh, and don't bother mentioning it's your birthday.

data.title: Poor rating because of the management and service.  Food was above average!
data.text:
Sunday Brunch:
Made reservations ahead and told them it was 0ur first time.  

FIRST:  Not told our table would be in the Loft, up a flight of steep stairs.  Ask hostess if we could change,  said they were full and all that was available. 
 
SECOND:  Waiter was terrible.  Knew very little about the dishes and could have cared less!  Said, he only works when they are busy!

FOOD:  Three people ordered  FRIED GREEN TOMATO BENEDICT 
Menu described it as follows poached eggs, braised pork shoulder, hollandaise.

When our waiter took the orders, we were asked how we wanted the  “POACHED EGG” cooked, soft, medium or hard.  

When the orders finally came, all the eggs were “FRIED”  hard, instead of poached.   We said the eggs were supposed to be POACHED. 

His answer was, they can’t poach eggs when they are this busy”. My husband ask why  didn’t you tell us that when we ordered?  We would like it replaced with a poached egg like the menu stated.   

The waiter said I will see, when he came back, he said if you want to replace the fried egg with a poached egg it will take awhile “because they can’t poach that many eggs at one time and the plates want all come out at the same time.   The other four people who ordered different items had already received they food at least eight minutes before ours came out with the fired egg on them.   So we went ahead and kept the fried eggs. 

What was more distrubing was No other person every came to our table to check on this problem or acknowledge it.    No consideration was given to us in any way.  

We have eaten in many top restaurants in the US and around the world and this is one of the worst service wise and managed restaurants we have been to.

Taste wise food was above average, but not outstanding by any means for the cost.

data.title: Wonderful, simply wonderful restaurant
data.text: We have been here a couple of times, once for brunch and once for dinner. Both were amazing. Wonderful place for special occasions.  Food is savory and perfect portions. Quiet dining experience and attentive waitstaff.

data.title: A 5 star restaurant in HSV!
data.text: I went here years ago and was sadly disappointed.  Since then I have been to their sister restaurant next door a dozen times (Commerce Kitchen), but their menu was getting stale for me so I tried Cotton Row again.  The service, food and atmosphere were all exceptional.  The price reflected it though!

data.title: Great Small Dining Experience!
data.text: We've eaten at Cotton Row three times in the past year and have never been disappointed.  The service is outstanding and the food is excellent.

data.title: Great Atmosphere!
data.text: Dinner for 10 in a private dining room was excellent. Greeted by a server in a common room (formerly a small kitchen) that served as a bar for the three private rooms upstairs. Decent wine list and well crafted cocktails. Restaurant touted itself as "local farm to table", but three recommended dishes were, Alaskan Sockeye Salmon, Maine Lobster and Gulf of Atlantic Bay Scallops. That technicality aside, the food was great. Only shortcoming was the lack of vegetarian choices. 20% of our party was dissatisfied with their choices.

data.title: Impressed
data.text: My wife and I ate there for the first time and were impressed. We ordered the filet and the red snapper. Both dishes were excellent as was the service.

data.title: A blah meal
data.text: This place is over priced and the chef is not accommodating to the guests...our food was greasy and the portions were very small

data.title: Upscale & Fantastic...
data.text: Our college football friends from Huntsville suggested we dine at the Cotton Row...Being from Pennsylvania, we agreed...Top shelf and 5 star in Huntsville!  Service, personality, attentiveness, quality of food, everything, you name it...we enjoyed every minute...we tried the Gulf Lump Crab Cake...We'll stay with our Chesapeake Blues...The Fried Chicken and Buttermilk Waffle with the Chefs special Hot Sauce was "out of this world!"  I will work on replicating that one...

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Service very slow. Courses served inappropriately. Cocktails not very timely. Used to be great. Hope they rectify the problem.

data.title: Wonderful Meal!
data.text: It's a beautiful restaurant in Downtown that feels like it would belong in a larger city.  Huntsville is very fortunate to have a restaurant of this quality.  The food was great and the management has loaded the place with very attractive staff.  Every staff member we encountered was very friendly.  My only gripe was that our waiter seemed overwhelmed with other tables and there were times we wouldn't see him for 20-30 minute gaps.  One odd behavior was that he had the valet to bring our car around but we hadn't paid by that point, then it took another 15 minutes to pay the check with the valet waiting with our car out front.

data.title: Excellent outing with great memories
data.text: I wanted to take my elderly (91 and 89) and disabled parents out for a " fancy" meal. I let the reservations person know of vision and mobility disabilities and we were given a special location that worked perfectly. That was just the beginning of a memorable evening that included innovative cocktails (try the Front Porch), delicious food, and great service from Bobby. The ambiance was lovely and quiet enough (even when full) to have good conversations.  One of our best outings in years. Thanks go out to Bobby and others at Cotton Row.
